intro: Jussiaea micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered jussiaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Jussiaea micrantha is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
